Welcome to hw14’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database connection is working. It does this by executing a simple SQL query and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then we know something’s wrong with the database connection.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Inject the database session into the function

Returns:

A dict

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.index()¶

The index function is the default function that will be called when a user visits the root of your API. It returns a simple message to let users know that they have successfully connected to your API.

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function marks a contact as confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the contact to be updated

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

The contact object that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact object from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact_id of the contact you want to get

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database based on the email address provided.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to be retrieved. db (AsyncSession): An async session for interacting with an SQLAlchemy database.

Returns:

Contact: A single Contact object matching the provided email address, or None if no match is found.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object or none if the email is not found

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(offset: int, limit: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first row to return

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(field_search, offset: int, limit: int, db: AsyncSession)¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

It takes three arguments: field_search, offset and limit. The field_search argument is a string that can be either an email or a name/phone number. The offset argument is an integer that specifies where to start returning results from (useful for pagination). The limit argument is an integer that specifies how many results to return (useful for pagination).

Parameters:

  • field_search – Search for a contact by name or phone number

  • offset – int: Determine where to start the search

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts_coming_birthday(offset: int, limit: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The search_contacts_coming_birthday function searches for contacts whose birthday is coming in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned by the query

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a contact.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to update. url (str): The URL for the new avatar image. db (AsyncSession): An async database session object, used to commit changes and refresh objects in memory after committing them to the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the contact from the database

  • url – str: Pass the url of the avatar to be updated

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact we want to update

  • body – ContactSchema: Pass in the data from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_token(contact: Contact, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a given contact.

Parameters:

  • contact – Contact: Get the contact object that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token of a contact

  • db – AsyncSession: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that email exists in our database, and if so, confirms their account.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the refresh token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the refresh token from the request header :return: A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address. The function takes in the body of the request, the background tasks object, and a database session. It then uses these objects to get information about the user from our database and sends them an email using our send_email function.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the api

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the email address from the user :return: A dictionary with a message key :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: ContactSchema, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

:param : Send an email to the user who has just signed up :return: The new user :doc-author: Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), cur_contact: Contact = Depends(get_current_contact))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an id of the contact to be deleted and returns a JSON object containing information about the deleted contact.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • cur_contact – Contact: Get the current contact

:param : Get the current contact :return: The deleted contact :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), cur_contact: Contact = Depends(get_current_contact))¶

The get_contact function is used to retrieve a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact_id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • cur_contact – Contact: Get the current contact object

:param : Get the contact id from the url path :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(request: Request, offset: int = Query(0), limit: int = Query(10), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), cur_contact: Contact = Depends(get_current_contact))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the contacts to be returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the parameter

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • cur_contact – Contact: Get the current contact from the database

:param : Get the current contact :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_coming_birthdays(offset: int = Query(0), limit: int = Query(10), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), cur_contact: Contact = Depends(get_current_contact))¶

The search_coming_birthdays function searches for contacts with birthdays coming up.

Parameters:

  • offset – int: Determine the offset of the query

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the offset parameter

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value for the offset parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • cur_contact – Contact: Get the current contact from the database

:param : Get the current contact :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contact(field_search: str, offset: int = Query(0), limit: int = Query(10), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), cur_contact: Contact = Depends(get_current_contact))¶
The search_contact function searches for contacts in the database.

The search is performed on the first_name, last_name and email fields of a contact. The function returns a list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • field_search – str: Search a contact by name or email

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • ge – Specify that the value must be greater than or equal to a given number

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set the minimum value of a parameter

  • le – Limit the number of results returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • cur_contact – Contact: Get the current contact

:param : Get the current contact :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_avatar_contact(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_contact: Contact = Depends(get_current_contact), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_contact function updates the avatar of a contact.
Args:

file (UploadFile): The uploaded image file. current_contact (Contact): The currently logged in user’s contact object. db (AsyncSession): An async session for database accesses.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • current_contact – Contact: Get the current user’s contact details

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the current user’s email address from the database :return: The updated contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), cur_contact: Contact = Depends(get_current_contact))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns a contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the data sent in the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • cur_contact – Contact: Get the current contact information

:param : Get the current contact :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'bbfa90db00ff64602957655112d8ce82dd58397c77bc97c79d52e4e371427a91'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long until this token expires, in seconds. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded in the jwt token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiry time of the token

Returns:

A jwt token, which is a string

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to now, while exp (expiration) is set to one day from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a jwt

Returns:

A token that is then used to send an email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The payload to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time until expiration of the token, defaults to 7 days if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that is to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Determine how long the token will be valid for

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function will raise an HTTPException if the token is invalid or has expired. If the token is valid, it will return a string with the email address of user who owns that refresh_token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_contact(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_contact function is a dependency that can be used to get the current contact.

It will check if the token is valid and return an HTTPException if it isn’t. If it’s valid, then we decode the token and get its payload (which contains information about who sent this request). We use this information to find out which contact made this request.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the header of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A contact object, which is a row from the contacts table

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first decodes the token using jwt.decode, which is part of PyJWT, a Python library for encoding and decoding JSON Web Tokens (JWTs). If successful, it will return the email address associated with that JWT.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for each account. -username: the username of the account that was just created. This is displayed in

confirmation message sent to them via email.

-host: this is used as part of URL that will be sent out in order for users to confirm their

accounts.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass in the username of the user who is registering

  • host – str: Pass the host url to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
